SPOTLIGHT The beginning of summer is upon us, and in addition to longer days and beach vacations, some of us are worried about the "slow season." Summer is a time of empty workplaces, out-of-office replies, and for independent consultants, a narrower pipeline. However, opportunity exists to reflect on and improve your career or business during this hot months.
If you haven't already, take our quiz <http://www.mbopartners.com/right-for-you> to see if independent work is right for you.
If you're already an experienced independent, check out the Grow phase <http://www.mbopartners.com/independents-guide/grow> of our Independent's Guide. We have great new content on selling yourself, marketing, becoming a thought leader and other ways to improve your business during vacation season.
Nicolette Taylor
Consultant Services Advisor Connect with Nicolette <http://www.linkedin.com/pub/nicolette-taylor/10/360/7a8>
MARKETING AND BRANDING TIPS FOR CONSULTANTS Marketing is the engine that drives a steady flow of opportunity into a small firm or solopreneur’s project pipeline. It is essential for independent consultants to create a strong brand and develop a plan for keeping that brand visible to their marketplace.
There’s a growing number of ways to reach and engage potential clients. From in-person networking to social media, there are a wide range of choices for any small business’s marketing toolbox.
In fact, there are so many choices, it’s easy to become overwhelmed. Have you asked yourelf how should you invest time in marketing?
In this guide we provide a foundation that will help you to develop a marketing plan specific to your business.
